metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1640 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The Web Store inline-installer implementation in the Extensions UI in Google Chrome before 49.0.2623.75 does not block installations upon deletion of an installation frame, which makes it easier for remote attackers to trick a user into believing that an installation request originated from the user's next navigation target via a crafted web site.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1640` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
chromium-browser-l10n - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
chromium-chromedriver - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112').
